result.execSummary:
The defendant Isaac J. METZ was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).
  • False Imprisonment, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain fulltime employment, schooling or a combination of both.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

No contact with the victim, P.A.H., or her family without agent's approval.

Comply with Sex Offender Registry.

Provide DNA sample and pay the surcharge.

timeConds.notes: Under the Huber Law, on count 1 only.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Transcript of sentencing hearing on revocation held on 10-01-15.   
Copy of transcript mailed to Registrar.
Sentencing Memorandum.
From atty. Larson requesting adjournment of SEHR.
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 10-01-2015 10:00 am
From Atty Ann Larson to Judge Fox
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 09-15-2015 02:00 pm
Amended Revocation Order and Warrant.
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 09-08-2015 10:00 am
Ann Larson, public defender.

The Court hereby orders that Mr. Metz be released from the requirements of the sex offender registry 15 years after he finishes his probation supervision as allowed under Wis. Stat. 301.45(5)(a)1.
Cover letter.
Copy of order delivered to DOC.

State files an Amended Information charging 1 ct. 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, contrary to Section 940.225(3) of the Wisconsin Statutes; 1 ct. Strangulation and Suffocation, contrary to Section 940.235(1); 1 ct. False Imprisonment, contrary to Section 940.30 and 1 ct. Disorderly conduct, contrary to Section 947.01(1).  
Count 1 - Third degree sexual assault - No contest plea.  
Count 3 - False imprisonment - No contest plea.  Convicted.   State moves to dismiss and read in count 2, Strangulation and suffocation and count 4, disorderly conduct.  Motion granted.  Court orders a pre-sentence investigation report to be completed by DOC.  Sentencing hearing is set for 08-01-14 at 9:00 a.m.  Report to be filed by 07-28-14.  
Plea Quesitonnaire/Waiver of Rights.  
Minutes.

Settlement Conference Summary.
Plea hearing is set for 05-22-14 at 1:30 p.m.
Defendant's Notice of Motion; Defendant's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for further proceedings.  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.  
ARRAIGNMENT
Information filed.  Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 05-01-14 at 2:45 p.m.  Plea date is set for 05-22-14 at 1:30 p.m.  State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.  
Minutes.
Jewel Scharenbroch, Public Defender.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 04-01-14 at 8:30 a.m.  
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of 2nd degree sexual assault, sex with child under 16 years or older, disorderly conduct and strangulation and suffocation.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 03-24-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $1,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he have no contact with P.A.H., DOB: 01-28-1997 or her residence.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.
Minutes.
